description: In the dozens of versions for the big and small screens, artists have tried to make “Jane Eyre” their own.
title: Jane, Rochester and That Zombie
title_page: Jane, Rochester and That Zombie - The New York Times
maintext:
Slide 1 of 7,
In the dozens of versions for the big and small screens, opera, theater and even ballet, artists have tried to make “Jane Eyre” their own. Some succeed — the 1973 mini-series is “almost the same as reading the novel for me,” said Charlene Cruz, who runs the Enthusiast’s Guide to Jane Eyre Adaptations at eyreguide.awardspace.co.uk — others have gone far afield. Would Charlotte Brontë recognize her creation?
STEPHANIE GOODMAN
Mia Wasikowska in the 2011 version of "Jane Eyre."
﻿
